contents: (1) Electromagnetic waves differ from mechanical waves in that they do not require a matter medium to propagate. (2) Electromagnetic waves, by traveling through electromagnetic fields, can travel not only through air and solid materials, but also through the vacuum of space. (3) In the 1860s and 1870s, a Scottish scientist named James Clerk Maxwell developed a scientific theory to explain electromagnetic waves. (4) He noticed that electrical fields and magnetic fields can couple together to form electromagnetic waves. (5) He summarized this relationship between electricity and magnetism into what are now referred to as "Maxwell's Equations."
